value.0:
The Basics of Woodworking:

You will require access to proper materials such as oak or darkwood. Then, you must have access to a proper workstation, a carpentry table is required for woodworking.


Quarterstaff:
Begin with the saw twice.  Then use the lathe.  Use the planer, then the lathe and finally the planer again.

Light Crossbow:
The light crossbow requires two passes of the planer, then saw off one end and then the other.  Finish it with the lathe and the planer again.

Heavy Crossbow:
Start with the saw, then the planer and saw again.  Move on to the planer, pass it through the lathe and saw it again.

Shortbow:
The shortbow starts with the planer, then use the saw twice.  Plane it again then use the lathe and saw.

Longbow:
The longbow starts with two passes of the planer.  Then the saw.  Use the planer again and finish with the lathe.

Club:
The club needs to have two passes of the saw then the planer.  Then twice with the saw again and finish with the lathe.

Dart:
A dart requires the saw and planer.  Then the saw and lathe.  Then finally several cuts with the saw.

Bolt:
The bolt needs to have the saw then the planer and repeat.  Then the saw and lathe.

Arrow:
The arrow requires the planer then the saw followed by two more passes with the planer.  Finally use the lathe and saw again.
